channel.title: PHP script to compress web traffic
channel.description:
Hey guys, I wrote this for a website I'm working on. It's basically a script to enforce gzip compression if your webhost doesn't support it. Enjoy :)
[url=http://www.cakenet.net/content/compressing-content-php]http://www.cakenet.net/content/compressing-content-php[/url]

item.title: PHP script to compress web traffic
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Pretty neat idea and implementation, but what kind of crappy webhost doesn’t support compression? That in itself is pretty ridiculous.

Personally, lighttpd handles all of this stuff for me.

Read full topic
item.source: PHP script to compress web traffic

item.title: PHP script to compress web traffic
item.dc:creator: @Fsig Fsig
item.description:
@Fsig wrote:

eczema3:

I don’t see whats wrong with using the built-in output buffer functions with ob_gzhandler.

I have only just started using any kind of compression and came to the same conclusion.

Here are three examples of my server.

Original Size: 2.35 KB
Gzipped Size: 0.92 KB
Data Savings: 60.85%

Original Size: 8.47 KB
Gzipped Size: 2.19 KB
Data Savings: 74.14%

Original Size: 18.56 KB
Gzipped Size: 3.52 KB
Data Savings: 81.03%

Read full topic
item.source: PHP script to compress web traffic
